alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 12:17PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Alamosa, west central Huerfano and north central Costilla Counties through 1245 PM MDT... At 1217 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blanca, or 16 miles west of Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanca Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley
